item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, March 26, 2025 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenAI adds MCP support to Agents SDK (226 points | 57 comments)
2. Debian bookworm live images now reproducible (304 points | 70 comments)
3. After 50 million miles, Waymos crash a lot less than human drivers (13 points | 1 comment)
4. A love letter to the CSV format (204 points | 207 comments)
5. Malware found on NPM infecting local package with reverse shell (104 points | 54 comments)
6. Good-bye core types; Hello Go as we know and love it (144 points | 49 comments)
7. Playwright Tools for MCP (54 points | 10 comments)
8. Problems with the Heap (36 points | 5 comments)
9. Botswana Successfully Launches First Satellite, Botsat-1 (96 points | 27 comments)
10. Building a Firecracker-Powered Course Platform to Learn Docker and Kubernetes (8 points | 1 comment)
11. MCP server for Ghidra (134 points | 18 comments)
12. Oracle customers confirm data stolen in alleged cloud breach is valid (30 points | discuss)
13. Sharding Pgvector (49 points | 6 comments)
14. Weave (YC W25) is hiring a founding product engineer ( | hide)
15. Stockpile 72 hours of supplies in case of disaster or attack, EU tells citizens (36 points | 9 comments)
16. Writing Programs with Ncurses (26 points | 6 comments)
17. Gemma3 Function Calling (63 points | 8 comments)
18. Writing a tiny undo/redo stack in JavaScript (7 points | 1 comment)
19. Google will develop Android OS behind closed doors starting next week (144 points | 67 comments)
20. Google makes Android development private, will continue open source releases (51 points | 19 comments)
21. Kilo Code: Speedrunning open source coding AI (57 points | 39 comments)
22. How to Delete Your 23andMe Data (46 points | 10 comments)
23. Heap-overflowing Llama.cpp to RCE (211 points | 45 comments)
24. Google’s two-year frenzy to catch up with OpenAI (115 points | 117 comments)
25. The long-awaited Friend Compound laws in California (47 points | 93 comments)
26. Collapse OS (91 points | 61 comments)
27. An Interview with Zen Chief Architect Mike Clark (101 points | 7 comments)
28. All clothing is handmade (2022) (117 points | 129 comments)
29. Linux kernel 6.14 is a big leap forward in performance and Windows compatibility (145 points | 90 comments)
30. The Impact of Generative AI on Critical Thinking [pdf] (147 points | 100 comments)
